title: My first story
author: By yours Truly Shen Shen
content: Welcome to my blog! perhaps a glimpse into my subconscious.

title: Here we are
author: Shen Shen
content:
Summer is slowly fading here in Berlin, the heat softening into the kind of crisp mornings that remind you that seasons—and chapters—always turn. In many ways, it mirrors where I am in my journey with software development.

When I first started, I imagined it would be a straight road: you learn, you build, you move forward. Instead, I’ve discovered that it’s a series of curves, loops, and the occasional detour. There are the ups—when code finally runs after hours of debugging, or when a new concept clicks so clearly that you wonder how you didn’t see it before. And then there are the downs—syntax errors, broken builds, or the frustration of knowing what you want to create but not yet having the tools to bring it to life.

But every day adds a little more knowledge to the pile. Like layering brushstrokes on a canvas, these small increments start to reveal a bigger picture. What once felt overwhelming is slowly becoming familiar.

So here we are—end of summer, still learning, still stumbling, still getting back up. If there’s one thing this season has taught me, it’s that progress in software development isn’t about speed, it’s about persistence. And with each line of code, each problem solved, the journey becomes a little more rewarding.
